intro: Cynometra martiana var. procera, commonly known as the African shea tree, is a tall, evergreen tree native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Sapindaceae family and is characterized by its large, elliptical leaves and showy yellow flowers. The tree produces edible fruits that enclose a nutritious seed known as shea butter. It is well adapted to dry and semi-arid climates, making it an important component of local ecosystems. Its wood is valued for its durability and is used in construction and furniture making.
